newsitem.title: USA: Commerce Bancshares buys Shawnee State.
newsitem.headline: Commerce Bancshares buys Shawnee State.

text.p: Commerce Bancshares Inc, the parent of Commerce Bank, said Friday it signed an agreement to acquire Shawnee State Bank for an undisclosed price.

The company said the deal will expand Commerce Bank's presence in the Johnson County, Kansas, area, giving the bank 45 locations. Regulatory and shareholder approval is expected by the end of the first quarter of 1997, the company said.
Commerce Bancshares operates more than 240 offices in Missouri, Kansas and Illinois and it has assets of $9.4 billion. Its shares were trading up 3/8 Friday at 46-3/4.
